00026 #ifndef _CACHE_H
00027 #define _CACHE_H
00028 
00029 
00030 // Use the hashmap extensions if we are using >= gcc 3.1
00031 #ifdef __GNUC__
00032 
00033 #if (__GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 1) || (__GNUC__ >= 4)
00034 #define USE_HASHMAP 1
00035 #include <ext/hash_map>
00036 namespace __gnu_cxx
00037 {
00038   template<> struct hash< const std::string > {
00039     size_t operator()( const std::string& x ) const {
00040       return hash< const char* >()( x.c_str() );
00041     }
00042   };
00043 }
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 // And the high performance memory pool allocator if >= gcc 3.4
00047 #if (__GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 4) || (__GNUC__ >= 4)
00048 #define POOL_ALLOCATOR 1
00049 #include <ext/pool_allocator.h>
00050 #endif
00051 
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 
00055 #ifndef USE_HASHMAP
00056 #include <map>
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #include <iostream>
00060 #include <list>
00061 #include <string>
00062 #include "RawTile.h"
00063 
00064 
00065 
00067 
00068 class Cache {
00069 
00070 
00071  private:
00072 
00074   unsigned long maxSize;
00075 
00077   int tileSize;
00078 
00080   unsigned long currentSize;
00081 
00083 #ifdef POOL_ALLOCATOR
00084   typedef std::list < std::pair<const std::string,RawTile>,
00085     __gnu_cxx::__pool_alloc< std::pair<const std::string,RawTile> > > TileList;
00086 #else
00087   typedef std::list < std::pair<const std::string,RawTile> > TileList;
00088 #endif
00089 
00091   typedef std::list < std::pair<const std::string,RawTile> >::iterator List_Iter;
00092 
00094 #ifdef USE_HASHMAP
00095 #ifdef POOL_ALLOCATOR
00096   typedef __gnu_cxx::hash_map < const std::string, List_Iter,
00097     __gnu_cxx::hash< const std::string >,
00098     std::equal_to< const std::string >,
00099     __gnu_cxx::__pool_alloc< std::pair<const std::string, List_Iter> >
00100     > TileMap;
00101 #else
00102   typedef __gnu_cxx::hash_map < const std::string,List_Iter > TileMap;
00103 #endif
00104 #else
00105   typedef std::map < const std::string,List_Iter > TileMap;
00106 #endif
00107 
00109   TileList tileList;
00110 
00112   TileMap tileMap;
00113 
00114 
00116 
00120   TileMap::iterator _touch( const std::string &key ) {
00121     TileMap::iterator miter = tileMap.find( key );
00122     if( miter == tileMap.end() ) return miter;
00123     // Move the found node to the head of the list.
00124     tileList.splice( tileList.begin(), tileList, miter->second );
00125     return miter;
00126   }
00127 
00128 
00130 
00134   void _remove( const TileMap::iterator &miter ) {
00135     // Reduce our current size counter
00136     currentSize -= ( (miter->second->second).dataLength + tileSize );
00137     tileList.erase( miter->second );
00138     tileMap.erase( miter );
00139   }
00140 
00141 
00143 
00144   void _remove( const std::string &key ) {
00145     TileMap::iterator miter = tileMap.find( key );
00146     this->_remove( miter );
00147   }
00148 
00149 
00150 
00151  public:
00152 
00154 
00155   Cache( float max ) {
00156     maxSize = (unsigned long)(max*1024000) ; currentSize = 0;
00157     // 128 added at the end represents 2*average strings lengths
00158     tileSize = sizeof( RawTile ) + sizeof( std::pair<const std::string,RawTile> ) +
00159       sizeof( std::pair<const std::string, List_Iter> ) + 128;
00160   };
00161 
00162 
00164   ~Cache() {
00165     tileList.clear();
00166     tileMap.clear();
00167   }
00168 
00169 
00171 
00172   void insert( const RawTile& r ) {
00173 
00174     if( maxSize == 0 ) return;
00175 
00176     std::string key = this->getIndex( r.filename, r.resolution, r.tileNum,
00177                                       r.hSequence, r.vSequence, r.compressionType, r.quality );
00178 
00179     // Touch the key, if it exists
00180     TileMap::iterator miter = this->_touch( key );
00181 
00182     // If this index already exists, do nothing
00183     if( miter != tileMap.end() ) return;
00184 
00185     // Store the key if it doesn't already exist in our cache
00186     // Ok, do the actual insert at the head of the list
00187     tileList.push_front( std::make_pair(key,r) );
00188 
00189     // And store this in our map
00190     List_Iter liter = tileList.begin();
00191     tileMap[ key ] = liter;
00192 
00193     // Update our total current size variable
00194     currentSize += (r.dataLength + r.filename.length()*sizeof(char) + tileSize);
00195 
00196     // Check to see if we need to remove an element due to exceeding max_size
00197     while( currentSize > maxSize ) {
00198       // Remove the last element.
00199       liter = tileList.end();
00200       --liter;
00201       this->_remove( liter->first );
00202     }
00203 
00204   }
00205 
00206 
00208   unsigned int getNumElements() { return tileList.size(); }
00209 
00210 
00212   float getMemorySize() { return (float) ( currentSize / 1024000.0 ); }
00213 
00214 
00216 
00226   RawTile* getTile( std::string f, int r, int t, int h, int v, CompressionType c, int q ) {
00227 
00228     if( maxSize == 0 ) return NULL;
00229 
00230     std::string key = this->getIndex( f, r, t, h, v, c, q );
00231 
00232     TileMap::iterator miter = tileMap.find( key );
00233     if( miter == tileMap.end() ) return NULL;
00234     this->_touch( key );
00235 
00236     return &(miter->second->second);
00237   }
00238 
00239 
00241 
00251   std::string getIndex( std::string f, int r, int t, int h, int v, CompressionType c, int q ) {
00252     char tmp[1024];
00253     snprintf( tmp, 1024, "%s:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d", f.c_str(), r, t, h, v, c, q );
00254     return std::string( tmp );
00255   }
00256 
00257 
00258 
00259 };
00260 
00261 
00262 
00263 #endif
